Name: MULTEXT-East free lexicons 4.0
Description: These are morphological lexica available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: PAROLE Portuguese Lexicon
Description: This is a morphosyntactic lexicon available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN

Name: Concreteness and imageability lexicon MEGA.HR-Crossling
Description: These lexica contain concreteness and imageability predictions for 77 languages. They are available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: A machine-readable Persian-English dictionary
Description: This bilingual lexicon has been compiled for comparative as well as didactic purposes in the on-going VICAV project. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: ParaDi 2.0
Description: This is a lexicon of single-word paraphrases of Czech verbal multiword expressions. The resource is available for download from LINDAT.

Name: Simple Portuguese Lexicon
Description: This semantic lexicon is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: QTLeap specialized lexicons
Description: This lexicon is used for the automatic translation of specific IT domain expressions and is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: VALLEX 3.0
Description: This is a valency lexicon available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.
Annotation: verb senses (characterized by glosses and examples)

Name: DVPM-EtyMor
Description:
This is a lexical database focussing on the typology and morphology of verbs in medieval Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-StopWords
Description: This is a manually compiled exhaustive list of closed-class words in Portuguese. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Collocation lexicon of Slovene academic discourse Aleks
Description: This is a lexicon of entries typical for general Slovene academic discourse. The entries include typical context examples (collocations and examples of use) taken from KAS, a corpus of Slovene academic texts (see also the Academic corpora resource family), i.e. a morphosyntactically tagged synchronous and monolingual corpus, containing more than 1.5 billion words.#SEPThe resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI

Name: Basiscript Lexicon
Description: This is a lexicon that comprises all lemmas from the Basiscript Corpus. The Basiscript Corpus is an annotated collection of texts written by children in elementary school. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Italian Function Words v3
Description: This is a morphological lexicon. The resource is available for download from LINDAT.

Name: MWELexicon 1.1
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.PL.

Name: LX-DSemVectors
Description: This lexicon provides distributional semantic representations of Portuguese words. The dataset is available for download from GitHub.

Name: Port-AoA Words
Description:
This is a lexicon of words classified according to several psycholinguistic characteristics, such as neighborhood density, written-word frequency, familiarity, and imageability.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-Abbreviations
Description: This is a lexicon of abbreviations. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: LX-SimLex-999
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: OMBI Dutch-Arabic
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon that is suitable for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: LX-Rare Word Similarity Dataset
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: ViPER verb lexical database
Description:
This is a database of verb senses that includes their structural, distributional, and transformational properties.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: LX-WordSim-353
Description: This is a word-similarity lexicon. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: MarsaLex
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: CzEngClass 0.2
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to PDT-Vallex, EngVallex and external resources, such as FrameNet, VerbNet, WordNet, etc. The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: STO syntax (v2) - LMF format
Description: This syntactic lexicon is available for download from the CLARIN-DK repository.

Name: A machine-readable dictionary of Egyptian Arabic
Description: This lexicon presents a more comprehensive version of A machine-readable glossary of Egyptian Arabic. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: Extended dictionary of named entities NELexicon connected with Linked Open Data
Description: This lexicon contains Polish named entities connected with terminology from available resources within Linked Open Data (e.g. WordNet, DBPedia, Wikipedia, etc.). The resource is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: MULTEXT-East non-commercial lexicons 4.0
Description: These are morphological lexica available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Inflectional lexicon srLex 1.3
Description: This is a large inflectional lexicon where each entry consists of a (wordform, lemma, MSD, MSD features, UPOS, morphological features, frequency, per-million frequency) 8-tuple. The (wordform, lemma, MSD) triple frequencies are calculated on the hrWaC v2.2 corpus. The MSD tagset follows the MULTEXT-East V6 tagset for the Serbo-Croatian macro-language. The UPOS and morphological features follow the UD v2 specifications. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI

Name: Maltese Speech Engine Lexicon
Description: This is a speech lexicon that is useful for building speech-to-text systems. It is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Emotional Annotations Dictionary
Description: This is a lexicon with emotional annotation extracted from Polish Wordnet. The resource is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: EMOTAIX.PT
Description:
This is a lexicon of emotionally charged words in European Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: DVPM-SynSem
Description:
This is a lexical database focussing on the syntax and semantics of verbs in medieval Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: CroaTPAS
Description: This is a manually created verb sense lexicon.

Name: ILSP PsychoLinguistic Resource
Description: This is a lexicon for psycholinguistic research. The resource is available for download from clarin:el.

Name: Lexicon of discourse markers for European Portuguese
Description:
This lexicon contains pairs of discourse marker.
The lexicon covers conjunctions, prepositions, adverbs, adverbial phrases and alternative lexicalizations with a connective function.
For each discourse marker in the lexicon, there is information regarding its type, category, mood and tense restrictions over the sentence it introduces, rhetorical sense, as well as a link to an English near-synonym and a corpus example.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: The LiLaH Emotion Lexicon of Croatian, Dutch and Slovene
Description: This lexicon contains manual translations of the NRC Emotion Lexicon, which encodes the sentiment of a word (positive, negative) and its emotion association (anger, anticipation, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise, trust) for Croatian, Dutch and Slovene with a binary schema. Manual translations were produced by inspecting and correcting the automatic translations from English provided with the original lexicon. While translations to all 14,182 entries are provided for Slovene and Croatian, only translations for the 6,468 entries that have any sentiment or emotion associated with the word are given for Dutch. The resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Parole+ (2017-10-16)
Description: This is a lexicon for language technologies which offers access to syntactic information and is connected to SALDO senses. The resource can be download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: Slovene sentiment lexicon KSS 1.1
Description: This is a lexicon of sentiment labels available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: STO morphology (v2) - LMF format
Description: This morphological lexicon is available for download from the CLARIN-DK repository. It is also available in the .csvformat.

Name: Reference Lexicon for Belgian-Dutch (RBBN)
Description: This lexicon, which contains words and expressions typically of Dutch spoken in Belgium, is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Automatically constructed multiword lexicon hrMWELex v0.5
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: MorfFlex CZ
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from LINDAT.

Name: Walenty (2018-06-29)
Description: This is a lexicon of verb valency that is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Name: CombiLex
Description: This is a lexicon of words and word forms available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: The Database of Estonian Multi-Word Expressions
Description: This is a collection of lexica that contain multi-word expressions consisting of a verb and a particle or a verb and its complements. The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CELR distribution) and for online browsing through a dedicated website.

Name: NomLex-BR
Description:
This lexicon provides mappings between verbs and their nominalisations for Brazilian Portuguese.
The lexicon is available from PORTULAN.

Name: Database of the Western South Slavic Verb HyperVerb -- Derivation
Description:
This lexicon contains 3000 most frequent Slovenian and 5300 most frequent BCS verbs which are all coded for a number of properties related to verb derivation.
The database is a table where each verb is given a row of its own. The coded properties are organized in columns. Verbs in the database are coded for the following properties: root information, whether or not the verb has prefixes and the identity of the included prefix(es), whether or not the verb has suffixes and the identity of the included suffix(es) etc. All coded properties are explained in the accompanying pdf file.
This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.
Annotation: root, prefix and suffix information for verb forms

Name: CzEngVallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to the parallel PCEDT corpus. The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: PDT-Vallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to several Czech corpora (PDT, PCEDT Cz side, PDTSC, Faust). The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: EngVallex
Description: This is a valency lexicon linked to the English side of the PCEDT corpus (WSJ corpus). The resource is available for download from LINDAT and for online browsing.

Name: Porlex
Description: This is a lexicon that provides psycholinguistic and cognitive information that is useful to select stimulus materials for experiments and/or training vocabularies. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.
Annotation: orthographic and phonological/phonetic transcriptions, phonetic, MSD-tags, and frequency information

Name: OMBI Dutch-Indonesian
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: PREMOVE – A diachronic dataset of Ancient Greek and Latin annotated PREverbed MOtion VErbs
Description: This lexicon provides open-access, corpus-based annotations of preverbed motion verbs in Ancient Greek and Latin (8th century BCE – 2nd century CE). The lexicon follows the Guidelines for a linguistic annotation of preverbed verbs of motion. The annotations capture morphology, syntax, and semantics, in addition to geographical as well as textual metadata. There are 119,070 such annotations. The lexicon is available for download from the Oxford Text Archive.

Name: Slovene sentiment lexicon JOB 1.0
Description: This is a lexicon of sentiment labels available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Dutch Electronic Lexicon of Multiword Expressions
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Multifunctional Computational Lexicon of Contemporary Portuguese
Description: This is a frequency lexicon suitable for NLP specific purposes (information extraction, lemmatization, PoS tagging). The resource is available for download from META-SHARE (CLARIN PORTULAN distribution).

Name: Inflectional lexicon hrLex 1.3
Description: This is a large inflectional lexicon where each entry consists of a (wordform, lemma, MSD, MSD features, UPOS, morphological features, frequency, per-million frequency) 8-tuple. The (wordform, lemma, MSD) triple frequencies are calculated on the hrWaC v2.2 corpus. The MSD tagset follows the MULTEXT-East V6 tagset for the Serbo-Croatian macro-language. The UPOS and morphological features follow the UD v2 specifications. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI

Name: Word embeddings CLARIN.SI-embed.sl 1.0
Description: This is a lexicon of word embeddings that is available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: Morphological lexicon Sloleks 2.0
Description: This is a reference morphological lexicon of the Slovenian language developed to be used in NLP applications and language manuals. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: Database of Modern Icelandic Inflections
Description: This is a morphological lexicon created for use in language technology (LT), as a reference for the general public in Iceland, and for use in research on the Icelandic language. The term Modern Icelandic here refers to contemporary Icelandic, i.e. late 20th and 21st century usage. #SEPThe lexicon is available for download and online browsing through CLARIN-IS.

Name: Beseda Corpus Lemmatisation Lexicon
Description: This lexicon contains inflected open class words from the Dictionary of Standard Slovenian that are augmented by wordforms, their part of speech tags and their lemmas used during the PoS tagging and lemmatization of the Beseda corpus. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing.

Name: LEX-MWE-PT: Word Combination in Portuguese Language
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions. The resource is available for download from CLARIN PORTULAN.

Name: Reference Lexicon for Dutch
Description: This is a corpus-based monolingual lexicon available for download the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Basilex Lexicon
Description: This is a lexicon that comprises all lemmas from the Basilex Corpus. The Basilex Corpus is an annotated collection of texts written for children in elementary school. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Emoji Sentiment Ranking 1.0
Description: This is a lexicon of emojis available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing through a dedicated environment.

Name: VfrLPL
Description: This is a morphosyntactic lexicon available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: Automatically constructed multiword lexicon slMWELex v0.5
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: PAROLE-SIMPLE-CLIPS
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from LC4CLARIN.

Name: Morphalou
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: Word embeddings CLARIN.SI-embed.hr 1.0
Description: This lexicon contains word embeddings extracted from the Croatian web corpus hrWaC and a 400-million-token-heavy collection of newspaper texts. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: Word embeddings CLARIN.SI-embed.sr 1.0
Description: This lexicon contains word embeddings from the srWaC web corpus. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: Simple lexicon
Description: This is a semantic lexicon that is available for download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: A machine-readable glossary of Egyptian Arabic
Description: This lexicon has been compiled for comparative as well as didactic purposes in the on-going VICAV project. The resource is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: Démonette
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: CORDEX inflectional lookup data 1.0
Description: This lexicon consists of a pickled dictionary of 111,660 lemmas, and maps these lemmas to their corresponding word forms. This inflectional data lookup module serves as an optional component within the cordex library that significantly improves the quality of the results. Each word form in the dictionary is accompanied by its MULTEXT-East morphosytactic descriptions, relevant features (custom features extracted from morphosytactic descriptions with the help of Conversion utilities tool and its frequency within the Gigafida 2.0 corpus, or Gigafida 1.0 when other information is unavailable. The dictionary is used to select the most frequent word form of a lemma that satisfies additional filtering conditions (ie. find the most utilized word form of lemma "centralen" in singular, i.e."centralni"). This resource is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Name: Dicovalence
Description:
This is a verb-valency lexicon.
The lexicon specifies certain selectional restrictions, possible term manifestations (pronominal, phrasal), and whether the valency frames can be used in various passive constructions, as well as references to other valency frames for the same infinitive. The resource is available for download from ORTOLANG.

Name: DeriNet 1.6
Description: This is a lexicon of derivational relations (both compounding and inflections). The resource is available for download and online browsing through LINDAT.

Name: Automatically stress labelled morphological lexicon Sloleks 1.2, version 1.1
Description: This is an extended version of the morphological lexicon Sloleks 1.2 with added information about the stress of each word form. The resource is available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: e-Lex
Description:
This is a lexical database that consists of a one-word lexicon and a multi-word lexicon.
This lexicon is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: SALDO's morphology (2017-10-16)
Description: This is a semantic and morphological lexicon for language technologies. The resource can be download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: BioLexicon
Description: This is a large-scale, wide-coverage computational lexicon covering the biomedical domain. The resource is unavailable for download or online browsing, but can be accessed by contacting the resource manager.
Size: over 2.2 million entries (over 3.3 million semantic relations)

Name: Lexicon of historical Slovene imp25k 1.1
Description: This is a morphological lexicon available for download from CLARIN.SI and for online browsing through a dedicated environment.

Name: A machine-readable Persian-English glossary of verbs
Description: This lexicon of single-word verbs in Modern Persian is available for download from ARCHE.

Name: Automatically constructed multiword lexicon srMWELex v0.5
Description: This is a lexicon of multiword expressions available for download from CLARIN.SI.

Name: OMBI Arabic-Dutch
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: OpeNER Sentiment Lexicon Italian - LMF
Description: This is a sentiment lexicon available for download from ILC4CLARIN.

Name: Old Swedish morphology (2017-10-16)
Description: This is a glossary of Old Swedish that is available for download from the SWE-CLARIN repository and can be queried online through KARP.

Name: OMBI Dutch-Danish
Description: This is a bilingual lexicon for language technology applications such as automatic translation, e-learning, multilingual information retrieval, etc. The resource is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).

Name: Italian Content Words v3
Description: This is a morphological lexicon. The resource is available for download from LINDAT.

Name: PAROLE Lexicon
Description: This morphosyntactic lexicon is available for download from the Dutch Language Institute (INT).
